required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Boceprevir (SCH 503034) Plus Peg-Intron, With and Without Added Ribavirin, in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C, Genotype 1, Who Did Not Respond to Previous Treatment With Peginterferon Alfa Plus Ribavirin (Study P03659AM2)(COMPLETED)
clinical_study.official_title: PEG-Intron/REBETOL vs PEG-Intron/ SCH 503034 With and Without Ribavirin in Chronic Hepatitis C Virus Genotype 1 (HCV-1) Peginterferon Alfa/Ribavirin Nonresponders: A SCH 503034 Dose-Finding Phase 2 Study

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to determine the safe and effective dose range of boceprevir (SCH 503034) in combination with PEG-Intron in adult subjects who have chronic hepatitis C without cirrhosis, and who have failed an adequate course of combination therapy with peginterferon-alfa plus ribavirin. A secondary objective is to explore whether ribavirin provides an additional benefit when combined with PEG-Intron plus boceprevir.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants Who Were Hepatitis C Virus Ribonucleic Acid (HCV-RNA) Negative at the End of Treatment (EoT)
primary_outcome.description: Sustained Viral Response (SVR) was defined as the percentage of participants with HCV-RNA undetectable at the follow-up Week 24. All percentages were based on the total number of participants originally randomized/enrolled to that particular arm. For Arm 1B, the denominator for the percentages was the number who received at least 1 dose of BOC. Arm 1A was not analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants Who Achieved Sustained Virologic Response (SVR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Week 73 [24 weeks after end of treatment (EoT)]
primary_outcome.description: SVR was defined as the percentage of participants with Hepatitis C Virus Ribonucleic Acid (HCV-RNA) undetectable at the follow-up Week 24. All percentages were based on the total number of participants originally randomized/enrolled to that particular arm. For Arm 1B, the denominator for the percentages was the number who received at least 1 dose of BOC. Arm 1A was not analyzed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants Who Achieved Sustained Viral Response (SVR) by Time to First Negative HCV-RNA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Week 73 [24 weeks after EoT]
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who became HCV-RNA undetectable within the first 13 weeks and subsequently became HCV-RNA positive were not considered negative for this analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Were HCV-RNA Negative at EoT After Receiving 1 Week of Treatment With PegIntron (PEG) by Log Drop
secondary_outcome.description: For each log drop category (<0, 0 to 0.5, 0.5 to <1, 1 to <1.5, ≥1.5, and Missing), the percentage of participants receiving combination therapy who were HCV-RNA negative at EoT (Week 49) was calculated as follows: Number of participants in a log category who were HCV-RNA negative divided by the total number of participants in that log drop category (n). Percentages were NOT derived using treatment arm N values. The sum of the n values for all 6 log drop categories within a treatment arm equals the overall N for that treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants With Virologic Response Prior to Amendment 2
secondary_outcome.description: Virologic response was defined as the percentage of participants with Hepatitis C Virus Ribonucleic Acid (HCV-RNA) ≤10,000 IU/mL.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: All visits during treatment (baseline to Week 49) except Day 1 of Week 1
secondary_outcome.description: All plasma samples were assayed using a validated liquid chromatography with tandem mass spectrometric detection (LCMS/MS) method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve of Boceprevir Plasma Concentration for an 8-hour Dosing Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: All visits during treatment (baseline to Week 49) except Day 1 of Week 1
secondary_outcome.description: All plasma samples were assayed using a validated liquid chromatography with tandem mass spectrometric detection (LCMS/MS) method. The dosing interval of 8 hours is represented as the hr in the unit of measure.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: All visits during treatment (baseline to Week 49) except Day 1 of Week 1
secondary_outcome.description: All plasma samples were assayed using a validated liquid chromatography with tandem mass spectrometric detection (LCMS/MS) method.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to dosing change (> 25 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in ALT levels during initial treatment regimen and after rolling into amendment 2 as compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were HCV-RNA Negative During Amendment 2 (AM2) for Those Who Started on Arms 2 (PEG+BOC 100), 3 (PEG+BOC 200), 4 (PEG+BOC 400 [48 Weeks]), 6 (PEG+BOC 400 [24 Weeks])
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From dosing change to end of follow-up (Week 73)(up to 48 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Log drop at baseline of dosing change = difference of log viral loads between baseline (closest to the treatment begin date) and dosing change baseline (virology value closest to the dosing change begin date).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were HCV-RNA Negative During Amendment 2 (AM2) for Those Who Started on PegIntron (PEG) + Rebetol (RVB) + Boceprevir (BOC) 400 (Arm 5)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From dosing change to end of follow-up (Week 73)(up to 48 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Log drop at baseline of dosing change = difference of log viral loads between baseline (closest to the treatment begin date) and dosing change baseline (virology value closest to the dosing change begin date).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were HCV-RNA Negative During Amendment 2 (AM2) for Those Who Started on PegIntron (PEG) + Boceprevir (BOC) 800 (Arm 7)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From dosing change to end of follow-up (Week 73) (up to 48 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Log drop at baseline of dosing change = difference of log viral loads between baseline (closest to the treatment begin date) and dosing change baseline (virology value closest to the dosing change begin date).

arm_group.description: A single dose of PEG is given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV for 12 weeks. If HCV-RNA is undetected, PEG + RBV will continue for another 36 weeks.

A single dose of PEG is given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV for 12 weeks. If HCV-RNA is detectable, BOC 400 mg TID will be added for 36 weeks. By second protocol amendment to P03659, participants will be rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

A single dose of PEG is given first, followed 1 week later by PEB + BOC 100 for 48 weeks. By second protocol amendment to P03659, participants will be rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

A single dose of PEG is given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 200 for 48 weeks. By second protocol amendment to P03659, participants will be rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

A single dose of PEG is given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 400 for 48 weeks. By second protocol amendment to P03659, participants will be rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

A single dose of PEG is given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV + BOC 400 for 48 weeks. By second protocol amendment to P03659, participants will be rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

A single dose of PEG is given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 400 for 24 weeks. By second protocol amendment to P03659, participants will be rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

By first protocol amendment to P03659, this non-randomized arm is added. A single dose of PEG is given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 800 for 24 weeks. By second protocol amendment to P03659, participants will be rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.
By second protocol amendment to P03659, participants from all arms except Arm 1A will be rolled over into PEG + RBV + BOC 800 for the remainder of the treatment period.

intervention.description: 100 or 200 mg capusles taken orally as 100 mg, 200 mg, 400 mg, or 800 mg TID
200 mg capsules taken twice daily (BID) (total daily dose of 800-1400 mg/day, depending on weight [weight-based dosing {WBD}])

criteria.textblock:
Key inclusion criteria:
- Documented infection with chronic hepatitis C (CHC), genotype 1.
- Documented failure to respond to an adequate course of treatment (minimum 12 weeks) with peginterferon-alfa plus ribavirin (failure defined as <2 log drop in HCV-RNA after 12 weeks of therapy or those who never become Hepatitis C Virus Ribonucleic Acid (HCV)-RNA negative)
- No evidence of cirrhosis on liver biopsy.
- Results of physical examination and laboratory tests within specified ranges.
- Abstinence from use of abused substances.
Key exclusion criteria:
- Women who are pregnant or nursing a child.
- Patients with cirrhosis, co-infection with Hepatitis B or human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), and African-American patients (by protocol amendment 2, African-American patients can enroll).
- Previous treatment with any Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) polymerase or protease inhibitor.
- Patients who relapsed following response to previous treatment.
- Evidence of advanced liver disease, or liver disease from a cause other than CHC.
- Pre-existing psychiatric condition.

group.title: Arm 1A: PEG + RBV
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV + BOC 400. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 1B: PEG + RBV + BOC
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV for 12 weeks. If HCV-RNA was detectable, BOC 400 was added for another 36 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 2: PEG + BOC 100 (48 Weeks)
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 100 for 48 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 3: PEG + BOC 200 (48 Weeks)
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 200 for 48 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 5: PEG + RBV + BOC 400
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV + BOC 400. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: ARM 4+6: PEG + BOC 400 (24 + 48 Weeks)
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV + BOC 400. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 7: PEG + BOC 800
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 800. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 8: PEG + RBV + BOC 800
group.description: By protocol amendment 2, participants from all arms except Arm 1A were rolled over into PEG + RBV + BOC 800 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 1A: PEG + RBV OR Arm 1B: PEG + RBV + BOC 400
group.description: Arm 1A: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV for 12 weeks. If participant was HCV-RNA negative, PEG + RBV was continued for another 36 weeks. Arm 1B: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV for 12 weeks. If HCV-RNA was detectable, BOC 400 was added for another 36 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 2: PEG + BOC 100 (48 Weeks)
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 100 for 48 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 200 for 48 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 5: PEG + RBV + BOC 400
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV + BOC 400. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arms 4 + 6: PEG + BOC 400 (24 + 48 Weeks)
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC (24 or 48 weeks). By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 7: PEG + BOC 800
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 800. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percent of Participants Who Were Hepatitis C Virus Ribonucleic Acid (HCV-RNA) Negative at the End of Treatment (EoT)
outcome.description: Sustained Viral Response (SVR) was defined as the percentage of participants with HCV-RNA undetectable at the follow-up Week 24. All percentages were based on the total number of participants originally randomized/enrolled to that particular arm. For Arm 1B, the denominator for the percentages was the number who received at least 1 dose of BOC. Arm 1A was not analyzed.
outcome.population: For PEG + RBV + BOC number of participants was number who received at least one dose of BOC. For all others, it was number of randomized participants. The PEG + BOC 800 arm was not randomized.

measure.title: Percent of Participants Who Were Hepatitis C Virus Ribonucleic Acid (HCV-RNA) Negative at the End of Treatment (EoT)
measure.description: Sustained Viral Response (SVR) was defined as the percentage of participants with HCV-RNA undetectable at the follow-up Week 24. All percentages were based on the total number of participants originally randomized/enrolled to that particular arm. For Arm 1B, the denominator for the percentages was the number who received at least 1 dose of BOC. Arm 1A was not analyzed.
measure.population: For PEG + RBV + BOC number of participants was number who received at least one dose of BOC. For all others, it was number of randomized participants. The PEG + BOC 800 arm was not randomized.

outcome.title: Percent of Participants Who Achieved Sustained Viral Response (SVR) by Time to First Negative HCV-RNA
outcome.description: Percentage of participants who became HCV-RNA undetectable within the first 13 weeks and subsequently became HCV-RNA positive were not considered negative for this analysis.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Week 73 [24 weeks after EoT]
outcome.population: Number of participants across all treatment arms who achieved negative HCV-RNA

group.title: 0 to ≤ 4 Weeks to First Negative HCV-RNA Group
group.description: Participants who achieved first negative HCV RNA within the first 4 weeks of treatment.

group.title: >4 to 8 Weeks to First Negative HCV-RNA Group
group.description: Participants who achieved first negative HCV RNA between weeks 4 to 8.

group.title: >8 to 12 Weeks to First Negative HCV-RNA Group
group.description: Participants who achieved first negative HCV RNA between weeks 8 to 12.

group.title: >12 to 36 Weeks to First Negative HCV-RNA Group
group.description: Participants who achieved first negative HCV RNA between weeks 12 to 36.

measure.title: Percent of Participants Who Achieved Sustained Viral Response (SVR) by Time to First Negative HCV-RNA
measure.description: Percentage of participants who became HCV-RNA undetectable within the first 13 weeks and subsequently became HCV-RNA positive were not considered negative for this analysis.
measure.population: Number of participants across all treatment arms who achieved negative HCV-RNA

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Were HCV-RNA Negative at EoT After Receiving 1 Week of Treatment With PegIntron (PEG) by Log Drop
outcome.description: For each log drop category (<0, 0 to 0.5, 0.5 to <1, 1 to <1.5, ≥1.5, and Missing), the percentage of participants receiving combination therapy who were HCV-RNA negative at EoT (Week 49) was calculated as follows: Number of participants in a log category who were HCV-RNA negative divided by the total number of participants in that log drop category (n). Percentages were NOT derived using treatment arm N values. The sum of the n values for all 6 log drop categories within a treatment arm equals the overall N for that treatment group.
outcome.population: N=Number of Participants Analyzed, n=number of participants in each log category group. The PEG + BOC 100, 200, or 400 arm combined the following treatment arms: Arm 2 PEG + BOC 100 (48 weeks), Arm 3 PEG + BOC 200 (48 weeks), Arm 4 PEG + BOC 400 (48 weeks), Arm 6 PEG + BOC 400 (24 weeks).

group.title: Arms 2, 3, 4, 6: PEG + BOC 100, 200, or 400
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 5: PEG + RBV + BOC 400
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV + BOC 400. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 7: PEG + BOC 800
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 800. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

Percentages were NOT derived using treatment arm N values. The sum of the n values for all 6 log drop categories within a treatment arm equals the overall N for that treatment group.
measure.population: N=Number of Participants Analyzed, n=number of participants in each log category group. The PEG + BOC 100, 200, or 400 arm combined the following treatment arms: Arm 2 PEG + BOC 100 (48 weeks), Arm 3 PEG + BOC 200 (48 weeks), Arm 4 PEG + BOC 400 (48 weeks), Arm 6 PEG + BOC 400 (24 weeks).

outcome.title: Percent of Participants With Virologic Response Prior to Amendment 2
outcome.description: Virologic response was defined as the percentage of participants with Hepatitis C Virus Ribonucleic Acid (HCV-RNA) ≤10,000 IU/mL.

group.title: Arm 1A: PEG + RBV and Arm 1B: PEG + RBV + BOC 400
group.description: Arm 1A: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV for 12 weeks. If participant was HCV-RNA negative, PEG + RBV was continued for another 36 weeks. Arm 1B: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV for 12 weeks. If HCV-RNA was detectable, BOC 400 was added for another 36 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

measure.description: Virologic response was defined as the percentage of participants with Hepatitis C Virus Ribonucleic Acid (HCV-RNA) ≤10,000 IU/mL.

outcome.title: Peak Plasma Concentration of Boceprevir (BOC)
outcome.description: All plasma samples were assayed using a validated liquid chromatography with tandem mass spectrometric detection (LCMS/MS) method.
outcome.time_frame: All visits during treatment (baseline to Week 49) except Day 1 of Week 1
outcome.population: Participants were only included in the analysis if the recorded previous dose of boceprevir was taken < 8.5 hours prior to sample collection. Participants also must have started BOC treatment or amendment 2 dosing more than 1 week prior to sample collection.

group.title: BOC 100 mg Dose
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by Arm 2 (PEG + BOC 100). By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: BOC 200 mg Dose
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by Arm 3 (PEG + BOC 200). By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: BOC 400 mg Dose
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by Arms 1B, 4, 5, 6, or 7. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: BOC 800 mg Dose
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 800 or PEG + RBV + BOC 800. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

measure.title: Peak Plasma Concentration of Boceprevir (BOC)
measure.description: All plasma samples were assayed using a validated liquid chromatography with tandem mass spectrometric detection (LCMS/MS) method.
measure.population: Participants were only included in the analysis if the recorded previous dose of boceprevir was taken < 8.5 hours prior to sample collection. Participants also must have started BOC treatment or amendment 2 dosing more than 1 week prior to sample collection.

measure.description: All plasma samples were assayed using a validated liquid chromatography with tandem mass spectrometric detection (LCMS/MS) method. The dosing interval of 8 hours is represented as the hr in the unit of measure.
measure.population: Participants were only included in the analysis if the recorded previous dose of boceprevir was taken < 8.5 hours prior to sample collection. Participants also must have started BOC treatment or amendment 2 dosing more than 1 week prior to sample collection.

outcome.description: All plasma samples were assayed using a validated liquid chromatography with tandem mass spectrometric detection (LCMS/MS) method.

outcome.population: Participants were only included in the analysis if the recorded previous dose of boceprevir was taken < 8.5 hours prior to sample collection. Participants also must have started BOC treatment or amendment 2 dosing more than 1 week prior to sample collection.

outcome.title: Change in Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Levels
outcome.description: Change in ALT levels during initial treatment regimen and after rolling into amendment 2 as compared to baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to dosing change (> 25 weeks)
outcome.population: Only participants with at least one value for the laboratory test were included.

group.title: Arm 1A: PEG + RBV
group.description: Arm 1A: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV for 12 weeks. If participant was HCV-RNA negative, PEG + RBV was continued for another 36 weeks.

group.title: Arm 1B: PEG + RBV + BOC 400
group.description: Arm 1B: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV for 12 weeks. If HCV-RNA was detectable, BOC 400 was added for another 36 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 8: PEG + RBV + BOC 800
group.description: By protocol amendment 2, participants from all arms except Arm 1A were rolled over into PEG + RBV + BOC 800 for the remainder of the treatment period.

measure.title: Change in Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Levels
measure.description: Change in ALT levels during initial treatment regimen and after rolling into amendment 2 as compared to baseline.
measure.population: Only participants with at least one value for the laboratory test were included.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Were HCV-RNA Negative During Amendment 2 (AM2) for Those Who Started on Arms 2 (PEG+BOC 100), 3 (PEG+BOC 200), 4 (PEG+BOC 400 [48 Weeks]), 6 (PEG+BOC 400 [24 Weeks])
outcome.description: Log drop at baseline of dosing change = difference of log viral loads between baseline (closest to the treatment begin date) and dosing change baseline (virology value closest to the dosing change begin date).
outcome.time_frame: From dosing change to end of follow-up (Week 73)(up to 48 weeks)
outcome.population: All participants, per the second amendment to P03659, with significant HCV-RNA decrease (HCV_RNA ≤ 10,000 IU) switched to continuing triple therapy.

group.title: Log Drop 0 to <1
group.description: All arms were given single dose of PEG first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 100 for 48 weeks for Arm 2 (PEG+BOC 100), followed by PEG + BOC 200 for 48 weeks for Arm 3 (PEG+BOC 200), followed by PEG + BOC (24 or 48 weeks) for Arm 4 (PEG+BOC 400 [48 weeks]) and Arm 6 (PEG+BOC 400 [24 weeks]). By protocol amendment 2, participants were switched to an increased dose of BOC 800 TID plus RBV with PEG for an additional 24 Weeks of Treatment.

group.title: Log Drop 1 to <2
group.description: All arms were given single dose of PEG first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 100 for 48 weeks for Arm 2 (PEG+BOC 100), followed by PEG + BOC 200 for 48 weeks for Arm 3 (PEG+BOC 200), followed by PEG + BOC (24 or 48 weeks) for Arm 4 (PEG+BOC 400 [48 weeks]) and Arm 6 (PEG+BOC 400 [24 weeks]). group.description: Arm 7: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 800. By protocol amendment 2, participants were switched to PEG + RBV + BOC 800 for an additional 24 Weeks of Treatment.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Were HCV-RNA Negative During Amendment 2 (AM2) for Those Who Started on PegIntron (PEG) + Boceprevir (BOC) 800 (Arm 7)
measure.description: Log drop at baseline of dosing change = difference of log viral loads between baseline (closest to the treatment begin date) and dosing change baseline (virology value closest to the dosing change begin date).
measure.population: All participants, per the second amendment to P03659, with significant HCV-RNA decrease (HCV_RNA ≤ 10,000 IU) switched to continuing triple therapy.

class.title: End of follow-up after dosing change

outcome.title: Percent of Participants Who Achieved Sustained Virologic Response (SVR)
outcome.description: SVR was defined as the percentage of participants with Hepatitis C Virus Ribonucleic Acid (HCV-RNA) undetectable at the follow-up Week 24. All percentages were based on the total number of participants originally randomized/enrolled to that particular arm. For Arm 1B, the denominator for the percentages was the number who received at least 1 dose of BOC. Arm 1A was not analyzed.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Week 73 [24 weeks after end of treatment (EoT)]
outcome.population: For PEG + RBV + BOC number of participants was number who received at least one dose of BOC. For all others, it was number of randomized participants. The PEG + BOC 800 arm was not randomized.

group.title: Arm 1B: PEG + RBV + BOC 400
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV for 12 weeks. If HCV-RNA was detectable, BOC 400 was added for another 36 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 2: PEG + BOC 100 (48 Weeks)
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 100 for 48 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 3: PEG + BOC 200 (48 Weeks)
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 200 for 48 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arms 4 + 6: PEG + BOC 400 (24 + 48 Weeks)
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC (24 or 48 weeks). By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 5: PEG + RBV + BOC 400
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV + BOC 400. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: Arm 7: PEG + BOC 800
group.description: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 800. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

measure.title: Percent of Participants Who Achieved Sustained Virologic Response (SVR)
measure.description: SVR was defined as the percentage of participants with Hepatitis C Virus Ribonucleic Acid (HCV-RNA) undetectable at the follow-up Week 24. All percentages were based on the total number of participants originally randomized/enrolled to that particular arm. For Arm 1B, the denominator for the percentages was the number who received at least 1 dose of BOC. Arm 1A was not analyzed.
measure.population: For PEG + RBV + BOC number of participants was number who received at least one dose of BOC. For all others, it was number of randomized participants. The PEG + BOC 800 arm was not randomized.

group.title: PEG + RBV
group.description: Arm 1A: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV for 12 weeks. If participant was HCV-RNA negative, PEG + RBV was continued for another 36 weeks.

group.title: PEG + RBV + BOC 400 (24 Weeks)
group.description: Arm 1B: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV for 12 weeks. If HCV-RNA was detectable, BOC 400 was added for another 36 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: PEG + BOC 100 (48 Weeks)
group.description: Arm 2: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 100 for 48 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: PEG + BOC 200 (48 Weeks)
group.description: Arm 3: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 200 for 48 weeks. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: PEG + RBV + BOC 400 (48 Weeks)
group.description: Arm 5: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + RBV + BOC 400. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: PEG + BOC 400 (24 + 48 Weeks)
group.description: Arms 4 + 6: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC (24 or 48 weeks). By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: PEG + BOC 800 (24 Weeks)
group.description: Arm 7: A single dose of PEG was given first, followed 1 week later by PEG + BOC 800. By protocol amendment 2, participants were rolled over into Arm 8 for the remainder of the treatment period.

group.title: PEG + RBV + BOC 800
group.description: Arm 8: By protocol amendment 2, participants from all arms except Arm 1A were rolled over into PEG + RBV + BOC 800 for the remainder of the treatment period.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The principal investigator (PI) agrees to provide review copies to the sponsor 30 days prior to submission. The sponsor shall have editorial rights and the right to review and comment on the data analysis and presentation with regard to proprietary information, accuracy of information, and to ensure that the presentation is fairly balanced and in compliance with regulations. If the parties disagree, the PI agrees to meet with the sponsor to discuss and resolve any such issues or disagreement.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The implementation of amendment 2 led to changes in boceprevir dose in all treatment arms and different overall lengths of therapy within the same treatment arm, making the SVR endpoint uninterpretable.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
